lines: Purpose: Screen for ADHD-related traits in adults
Time frame: Over the last 6 months
Use case: Students, professionals, productivity & focus issues
Below are statements about attention, activity level, and impulsivity.
Please choose how often each statement applied to you during the past 6 months.
Response Options & Weights (Same for ALL Questions)
PART A: Core ADHD Screening Items (High Sensitivity)
•  0 – I never had difficulty finishing tasks once I started them.
•  1 – I rarely had difficulty finishing tasks.
•  2 – I sometimes had difficulty finishing tasks.
•  3 – I often had difficulty finishing tasks.
•  4 – I very often had difficulty finishing tasks.
•  0 – I never had difficulty organizing tasks.
•  1 – I rarely had difficulty organizing tasks.
•  2 – I sometimes had difficulty organizing tasks.
•  3 – I often had difficulty organizing tasks.
•  4 – I very often had difficulty organizing tasks.
•  0 – I never forgot appointments or obligations.
Q4. Avoiding tasks that require sustained mental effort
•  0 – I never avoided tasks requiring long mental effort.
•  4 – I very often avoided such tasks.
•  0 – I never fidgeted or felt restless.
•  4 – I very often fidgeted or felt restless.
Q6. Feeling driven or overly active
•  0 – I never felt overly driven or “on the go.”
•  4 – I very often felt overly driven or restless.
•  4 – I very often made careless mistakes.
•  0 – I never had trouble sustaining attention.
•  1 – I rarely had trouble sustaining attention.
•  2 – I sometimes had trouble sustaining attention.
•  3 – I often had trouble sustaining attention.
•  4 – I very often had trouble sustaining attention.
Q9. Difficulty listening when spoken to
•  4 – I very often had difficulty listening.
•  0 – I never lost things needed for tasks.
•  4 – I very often lost important things.
•  0 – I was never forgetful in daily activities.
•  0 – I never had difficulty waiting my turn.
•  4 – I very often had difficulty waiting.
•  4 – I very often blurted out answers.
•  0 – I was always able to relax.
•  4 – I very often had difficulty relaxing.
If ≥4 items score 3 or 4 → ADHD traits flagged
High total + impairment Strong referral recommended
“Your responses show patterns commonly seen in adults with attention or hyperactivity
“This is a screening result, not a diagnosis.”
•  Avoid mislabeling depression or anxiety as ADHD
“We use an ASRS-aligned self-report screener to identify attention and hyperactivity traits in adults
and guide appropriate referral, without making diagnostic claims.”
